lead_paragraph: The ruling shows that Judge Rosemary Collyer was unimpressed with the analysis underpinning the MetLife designation as “systemically important.”

headline.print_headline: Judge Rejected Regulators’ Analysis That MetLife Was Too Big to Fail
headline.main: Ruling Behind MetLife’s ‘Too Big to Fail’ Reprieve Unsealed

snippet: The ruling shows that Judge Rosemary Collyer was unimpressed with the analysis underpinning the MetLife designation as “systemically important.”
abstract: Federal District Court Judge Rosemary Collyer, in March 30 decision recently made public, ruled regulators failed to properly name MetLife, largest life insurer in United States, as 'systemically important'; lapse allows insurer to shed its 'too big to fail' designation; Treasury Dept will appeal decision, major setback for supporters of Dodd-Frank reform.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
